extendedIngredients.name: ale
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 1/3 cup Blue Moon Harvest Pumpkin Ale or any pumpkin ale)

extendedIngredients.name: yellow cake mix
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 box yellow cake mix (I used Betty Crocker)

recipes.title: Spiced Cream Cheese Frosted Pumpkin Ale Cupcakes

winePairing.pairingText: Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port are great choices for Cupcakes. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. You could try NV Johnson Estate Cream Sherry. Reviewers quite like it with a 5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 19 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: NV Johnson Estate Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: Very aromatic with notes of hazelnut, vanilla, and a touch of oak followed by sweet raisins and a touch of yeast. Clean lasting finish. Good now but will reward those allow it to age"". A favorite pre-prandial beverage. Consider it with nuts before dinner as an aperitif, or after dinner with dessert, especially chocolates and fruit-based desserts. Also wonderful on cold afternoons, served with biscotti to dip in ""Italian-style"". "

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven according to package directions.  Line pan with cupcake liners.You are substituting the water and oil listed on the cake mix directions for the pumpkin puree and beer.  Do not add oil and water.Mix all ingredients on medium speed 2-3 minutes until well incorporated.Bake according to package directions, mine were done at 21 minutes when toothpick inserted came out clean.Allow to cool completely before frosting.Beat cream cheese with electric mixer 2-3 minutes until airy.  Gradually add in all other ingredients & mix until well blended & smooth.

steps.step: Preheat oven according to package directions.  Line pan with cupcake liners.You are substituting the water and oil listed on the cake mix directions for the pumpkin puree and beer.  Do not add oil and water.
Mix all ingredients on medium speed 2-3 minutes until well incorporated.

Bake according to package directions, mine were done at 21 minutes when toothpick inserted came out clean.Allow to cool completely before frosting.Beat cream cheese with electric mixer 2-3 minutes until airy.  Gradually add in all other ingredients & mix until well blended & smooth.
